title.narrative: Food assistance to new arrivals in Magumeri LGA, Borno State

description.narrative: The source of livelihoods of the affected population who has just been displaced has been destroyed due the attacks from the insurgents, hence the need to ameliorate their suffering. The fluid nature of the crisis produces displacement figures that vary significantly between Local Government Areas (LGAs) where we are currently providing food assistance. Between October 2018 and July 2019, Magumeri increased by 5% (DTM assessments, 2019). The project will contribute in reducing the impact of malnutrition and starvation through emergency food assistance. It is targeted specifically to new arrivals in Magumeri, where the partner has been implementing emergency response. The new arrivals have not been targeted so far and are very vulnerable. Beneficiary households (300HHs), 1,500 individuals. Male adults (112) Female adults (424) Children (964) The beneficiaries will be targeted through House to house assessment using a predefined selection criteria to profile new beneficiaries. These criteria include. - New arrivals - Households with aged persons (60years and above) - Pregnant/lactating mothers - Female headed households - Households with persons with special ability - Households with children (5years and below)
